channel.title: Toward a new world
channel.description:
Lectures recorded at San Diego State College's 25th Annual Institute on World Affairs. The Institute brings together world leaders to discuss issues in politics, culture, science, and more.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Abolition of economic exploitation, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by Dr. John Letiche, University of California, Berkeley.
item.dc:creator: San Diego State University
item.dc:subject: World politics--1945-1989

item.title: A philosopher looks toward a new world, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a lecture from Dr. Abraham Kaplan, University of Michigan.
item.dc:creator: San Diego State University
item.dc:subject: World politics--1945-1989

item.title: East-West relations, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by Dr. Josef Korbel, University of Denver.
item.dc:creator: San Diego State University
item.dc:subject: World politics--1945-1989

item.title: Democratic mythology: A new look, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a lecture by Dr. Fred Krinsky, University of Southern California.
item.dc:creator: San Diego State University
item.dc:subject: World politics--1945-1989

item.title: Pacem in Terris, Johnson & Vietnam, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by Dr. Fred Neal, Claremont Graduate School.

item.dc:subject: World politics--1945-1989

item.title: A new foreign policy for the United States, part one
item.description: This program features the first part of a lecture by Dr. Hans Morgenthau, director, Center for the Study of American Foreign Policy, University of Chicago.
item.dc:creator: San Diego State University
item.dc:subject: World politics--1945-1989

item.title: Intelligence and the policy process, part two

item.dc:subject: World politics--1945-1989
